definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Further, the compounds of the present invention have antiprotozoal properties.
sentences.chinese: 此外，本发明的化合物具有抗原生动物的性能。

sentences.english: The fastest of the recovered is Protozan after it is damaged, and the most slow is Copepoda.
sentences.chinese: 受损伤后恢复最快的最原生动物，最慢的是桡足类。

sentences.english: At this concentration, control of protozoan parasites can be achieved.
sentences.chinese: 在此浓度，控制原生动物寄生虫是可以实现的。

sentences.english: The tiny protozoans are believed to be the first animals to have appeared on earth.
sentences.chinese: 人们认为小原生动物是首先出现在地球上的动物。

sentences.english: Parasitic diseases in humans are caused by protozoans and helminthes.
sentences.chinese: 原生动物和蠕虫在人体中导致寄生虫疾病。

sentences.english: The parasites concerned are protozoa belonging to the Trypanosoma genus.
sentences.chinese: 涉及的寄生虫是一种原生动物，归类为锥虫属。

sentences.english: Giardia is a type of single celled organism called a protozoa (these are different to bacteria).
sentences.chinese: 贾第虫是一种单细胞有机体，所谓的原生动物。

sentences.english: Mostof these diseases are caused by protozoa, bacteria, or viruses.
sentences.chinese: 这些疾病多是由原生动物，细菌和病毒引起的。

sentences.english: Protozoan is one of the food organ isms for fish in Rivers.
sentences.chinese: 原生动物是江河鱼类的生物饵料组成之一。
